content.question: The diagrams above represent physical changes for potassium. Which of the following correctly identifies the physical process and provides the correct sign of <math alttext="delta S naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the process in the indicated diagram?

choices.label: In diagram 1, the process is freezing and <math alttext="delta S naught of freezing" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>freezing</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

In diagram 2, the process is melting and <math alttext="delta S naught of melting" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>melting</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

In diagram 3, the process is boiling and <math alttext="delta S naught of boiling" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>boiling</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

In diagram 4, the process is condensation and <math alttext="delta S naught of condensation" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>condensation</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive.

content.answer: In diagram 1, the process is freezing and <math alttext="delta S naught of freezing" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>freezing</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
